text: I say new Brigade oh hi everybody
Anthony Fantana the Internet's busiest
music nerd I'm filming this review late
it's 4 a.m. it's for 12 a.m. in the
morning and let me tell you this is
exactly what I needed to listen to it
for 12 in the morning these guys are a
Denmark band their name is ice age this
is their debut full-length new Brigade
it just got released on a u.s. record
label what we've got here is a 24 minute
post-punk record that sounds more
English than it does Danish these guys
are noisy and abrasive like the Jesus
and Mary Chain not in a not in a
shoegaze kind of way but you know what
I'm saying and also there's this cocky
swagger to them that reminds me of Gang
of Four or wire but those aren't the
best possible comparisons you could make
if you want to get more accurate
stylistically these guys are much more
of a annoys rock band maybe even a no
wave band because I definitely pick up
sounds that I would like into groups
like DNA there are a lot of influences
crashing into each other at high
velocity creating this mangled orgy of
metal and shattered glass hmm but still
new Brigade comes together with a really
cohesive sound surprisingly this thing
could have jumped all over the place and
it does a little bit but for the most
part these guys have a style and they
stick to it and they manipulate it in a
bunch of different ways throughout this
LP the sound is what really say is the
most consistent the vocals are loud
they're apathetic they feel kind of
slurred but they're also kind of wild
too and they have this echo um that just
makes them bounce all over the mix and
the bass is very warm very fuzzy and on
the opposite side of the spectrum you've
got the guitar which is so
trebled it's so brittle every pick
stroke sounds like metal rubbing against
metal and the trums come in loud and
clear - everything is just mixed so
evenly I like that it's so loud and
noisy and harsh and flailing in every
direction possible but I can make out
what I'm hearing loud and clear now the
harshness that I mentioned about this
album what I like about it is that it
doesn't come from a lot a lot of effects
and stuff like that mostly it's kind of
coming from how these guys play they
play so so raw but there is some
sweetness there to kind of mat match up
with the sour the songs for the most
part are very catchy very rhythmic very
angular very memorable in a way it
actually reminds me of that women album
that I loved last year there's a lot of
weirdness to it it's very kind of an
alienating album it's not a very
accessible album but yet there's
something almost unexplainable about it
that is so attractive as far as bright
spots go the hook on remember is almost
uplifting to me feels almost positive
and same goes for a broken bone maybe
even the last track on this LP - but for
the most part this record is is dark it
is a dark album it's like a really
really really cloudy day after two or
three straight months of nothing but
cloudy days it just kind of you know
begins to itch at your sanity a little
bit some tracks here just feel so tense
and and feel so Jerry the track white
rune just has such ugly guitars these
pounding just migraine inducing drums
also the title track the band is just
like bursting at the scene
total dredge just speeds up in spins and
spins it's kind of like what falling
down a spiral staircase must be like and
the song never returned finds this
really weird groove with these rolling
and these guitars that sound like
Picasso painted them and one of my
favorites on here and it's actually one
of the shortest count me in is kind of
like this this weird combination of
thrash punk and shoegaze it's executed
amazingly this album for me is something
that I just wanna I want to put on I
want to turn it up as loud as possible
and just sit back and watch something
burn and not like a campfire or anything
like that more like a building or a
forest and I know that sounds terrible
but this is a terrible album it's the
feel terrible hit of the summer hmm I'm
feeling a strong 8 to a light 9 on this
album for me it was really thrilling
invigorating noisy overwhelming and
something I will be returning to Anthony
Fantana ice age new Brigade forever
[Music]
